meanings.definition: A person or thing that spreads or scatters something, especially information or knowledge.
meanings.sent1: The disseminators of the flyers handed them out in the park.
meanings.sent2: The library books are great disseminators of wisdom and stories.
meanings.sent3: The little bird acted as a disseminator of gossip among the animals.
meanings.sent4: The internet serves as a powerful disseminator of news across the globe.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was a dedicated disseminator of knowledge to her students.

meanings.definition: The act of spreading or scattering something, especially information or knowledge.
meanings.sent1: The rapid disseminators of the virus caused a widespread outbreak.
meanings.sent2: The dissemination of rumors can lead to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: The disseminators of the party invitations forgot to include the date.
meanings.sent4: The dissemination of seeds by the wind ensures new plants grow in various places.
meanings.sent5: The disseminators of the newsletter worked diligently to reach every household.
